answers.answer: the kicks in the ribs!!!! ouch! or the 24/7 heartburn... i hated that...
AHhh, the heartburn.....

i had my lil guy 7 weeks ago and already miss being pregnant.  i lucked out and had a good pregnancy, the only thing i did not miss, juts like you mamaofone, i do not miss the 45 extra pounds of water and swelling which lead to preclampsia at my 38th week.

gaining the weight!!! getting feet shoved under my ribs and not being able to sleep on any side i want! other then that i miss it. i miss feeling the kicks and hiccups. seeing them on ultra sound and "playing with them" even though now i get to play with them for real! lol
What about...Did anyone notice your nose gets a little "bigger"??? AHh, I hated Pic's!
my whole face swelled up at the very end.  oh yeah and my A*S looked like it was pregnant and carrying another baby.
I am currently pregnant.  I will not miss peeing every 1/2 hour  and I will NOT miss the excess gas and hip pain.

I am 20 weeks and counting..... I am so looking forward to the day when I have no more constipation. Ugh it is the worse.  I had really bad with my first and now again with this one. The joy's of pregnancy!
I'm not going to miss the swelling. My poor right foot! The doc told me yesterday not to worry that one foot is bigger than the other because the other one will catch up soon enough.
I'm still pregnant, but I will not miss the gas, constipation, mood swings, fatiuge, and the aches and pains.

Well I'm currently pregnant with my third so I'm going to answer this a little differently---what I won't miss after I give birth is the SCIATIC PAIN! I am in so much pain right now that I am walking like I'm 90-yrs-old. UGH!leighanne- agree on the butt!

joy- its awful.  i felt like i was carrying twins, one in my belly and one in my butt.  at least my butt went right back down after though.  i hear you on the sciatic pain though, i had it bad early on.

thankfully i had an easy pregnancy, towards the end i do not miss the heartburn peeing all night not able to sleep on my belly and of course being huge. i will not even get into the labor i def do not miss anything about that!!!!
Yeah, my butt did that with my girls. And I am not looking forward to having it happen again. My derriere is already big enough!!!
peeing a little every time i cough or sneeze!! the pelvic pain, which my dr said wont go away until this baby is born!  heartburn, the swelling. "fat" face......i could go on!!

Oh my! I just had my little one 4 weeks ago and DO NOT miss anything about being pregnant! Its definitely a blessing but NOT FUN! UGH the hip pains, constipation, gettin up every 2 hours to pee.... being so tired and not being able to sleep! But its all worth it!

i am a lil over 12 weeks and i definitely not miss how tired i have been, my son has my sleeping schedule now.....as soon as i say im tired im gonna lay down he says he's tired too and he does go to sleep...lol! i have had on going constipation for the last 7 weeks on and off and i will not miss that, and the cramps i get every time i lay down..i have learned to fall asleep with myself/pillows propped against the wall to prevent the cramps..and it helps! i actually liked the kicks in the ribs with my son cause i knew he was doing okay in there every time i felt a shove/kick!!!

I had my daughter 2 months ago today..and what I dont miss is the heartburn, peeing all the time...and the swelling. I too, like leighanne, ended up with preeclampsia at the end which led to having to have a c-section when my labor wouldnt progress. I loved being pregnant in the beginning...but once I hit my 33rd week with preterm labor and NST tests 2-3 times a week..i was done with being pregnant!!

I am lucky to be having a really easy pregnancy. Usually I say I love everything about it (that's when I'm trying to convince DH we need 5 kids, lol), but if I'm being honest, I would say I WON"T miss the exhaustion!  It is just killer!!  No real aches and pains, just plain old tired and worn out.Oh, and the leg cramps, I just started waking up with them these past few days and they are so bad I could SCREAM!Other than that I'm loving it... =)
The weight gain, the swollen feet, the heartburn, the leg cramps.  Other than that I sort of miss being pregnant.  I see all these pregnant women and I want my belly...lol.

Well, you have all pretty much hit it all.  But there is one other thing I hate.  People have mentioned going to the bathroom a million times a day.  Well, of course we all have to get up in the middle of the night.  Well, once the baby gets bigger and you can def feel those hard kicks, I hate when I have to get up in the middle of the night to pee and then by getting up and changing gravity, this wakes the baby up.  Then the baby decides to kick and play until the alarm goes off.  I hate that.  I get up so very early and this happens to me all the time.  I mean as happy as I am to feel the baby moving so I know all is well, it would just be great if he/she could wait until AFTER the alarm goes off!  LOL!

question: Well, as some of you know I went off BC this month. As of right now here is no sign of AF or a + HPT. I don’t think this will be my month, Which is Ok........But I was just thinking about what I DONT miss about being pregnant....And beside waking up 3x a night to pee. The one thing I hated was, how much my feet swelled up. Even if I was wearing flip flops my feet would in gulp the shoes.....Ahhh, I DO NOT miss that!
title: OT a little: What you DON'T miss about being pregnant
